fullText: Review — Just in Time The Broadway Review: ‘Just in Time’ is safe, swoonful concert-style theater To no one’s surprise, star Jonathan Groff’s got the magic, vintage touch. , and Brittani Samuel April 27, 2025 . 8:58 PM 11 min read Share on Twitter Share on Facebook Share on LinkedIn Share via Email Jonathan Groff (center) and the company of “Just in Time” on Broadway, 2025 (Credit: Matthew Murphy and Evan Zimmerman) This post is for paying subscribers only Subscribe now Already have an account? dtliExcerpt: But the manner in which “Just in Time” unfolds is mercilessly predictable, so the beats rarely surprise; we feel every snap coming. For what it’s worth, Groff, Lawrence and Henningsen don’t seem to mind — they’re having a howling good time slipping into these characters’ shoes.
